intro: Hieracium steloides, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium steloides is often found in open habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
